key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities including delays and rising material costs
Economic sensitivity to government spending and agricultural sector health
Labor disputes, such as recent strikes at Gradall Industries LLC
Legal disputes including intellectual property and contract-related lawsuits
controversies: Recent labor strikes at subsidiary Gradall Industries LLC (April-May 2024)
Involvement in legal cases such as Alamo Group Inc. v. Fecon, Inc.
environmental_issues: Commitment to sustainability with targets for 2025, including energy efficiency and low-emission machinery
social_issues: Labor relations risks highlighted by recent strikes
Emphasis on ethical governance, labor rights, and community engagement
governance_issues: Recent board expansion and appointment of a new director (December 2024)
Preparation for CEO Jeff Leonard’s retirement

sources.snippet: Behnam Tabaie was sued by Alamo Group IX, LLC (Alamo) and obtained a judgment in his favor following a bench trial. He then sought an award of attorney fees on the basis that he had been required to prove facts at trial that Alamo had denied in response to his requests for admissions (Code Civ. Proc., § 2033.420).
